title: Google\Cloud\Storage\Lifecycle
name: Lifecycle
description:
Object Lifecycle Management supports common use cases like setting a Time to Live (TTL) for objects, archiving older versions of objects, or "downgrading" storage classes of objects to help manage costs.

This builder does not execute any network requests and is intended to be used in combination with either Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageClient::createBucket() or Google\Cloud\Storage\Bucket::update().

examples.caption: Access a builder preconfigured with rules already existing on a given bucket.
Or get a fresh builder by using the static factory method.

params.name: lifecycle
params.description: A lifecycle configuration. Please see here for the expected structure.

params.name: condition
params.description: The condition(s) where the rule will apply.

params.name: condition.age
params.description: Age of an object (in days). This condition is satisfied when an object reaches the specified age.

params.name: condition.createdBefore
params.description: This condition is satisfied when an object is created before midnight of the specified date in UTC. If a string is given, it must be a date in RFC 3339 format with only the date part (for instance, "2013-01-15").

params.name: condition.customTimeBefore
params.description: This condition is satisfied when the custom time on an object is before this date in UTC. If a string is given, it must be a date in RFC 3339 format with only the date part (for instance, "2013-01-15").

params.name: condition.daysSinceCustomTime
params.description: Number of days elapsed since the user-specified timestamp set on an object. The condition is satisfied if the days elapsed is at least this number. If no custom timestamp is specified on an object, the condition does not apply.

params.name: condition.daysSinceNoncurrentTime
params.description: Number of days elapsed since the noncurrent timestamp of an object. The condition is satisfied if the days elapsed is at least this number. This condition is relevant only for versioned objects. The value of the field must be a nonnegative integer. If it's zero, the object version will become eligible for Lifecycle action as soon as it becomes noncurrent.

params.name: condition.isLive
params.description: Relevant only for versioned objects. If the value is true, this condition matches live objects; if the value is false, it matches archived objects.

params.name: condition.matchesStorageClass
params.description: Objects having any of the storage classes specified by this condition will be matched. Values include "MULTI_REGIONAL", "REGIONAL", "NEARLINE", "ARCHIVE", "COLDLINE", "STANDARD", and "DURABLE_REDUCED_AVAILABILITY".

params.name: condition.noncurrentTimeBefore
params.description: This condition is satisfied when the noncurrent time on an object is before this timestamp. This condition is relevant only for versioned objects. If a string is given, it must be a date in RFC 3339 format with only the date part (for instance, "2013-01-15").

params.name: condition.numNewerVersions
params.description: Relevant only for versioned objects. If the value is N, this condition is satisfied when there are at least N versions (including the live version) newer than this version of the object.

methods.name: addSetStorageClassRule
methods.description: Adds an Object Lifecycle Set Storage Class Rule.

examples.caption: Using customTimeBefore rule with an object's custom time setting.

params.name: storageClass
params.description: The target storage class. Values include "MULTI_REGIONAL", "REGIONAL", "NEARLINE", "COLDLINE", "STANDARD", and "DURABLE_REDUCED_AVAILABILITY".

params.name: condition
params.description: The condition(s) where the rule will apply.

params.name: condition.age
params.description: Age of an object (in days). This condition is satisfied when an object reaches the specified age.

params.name: condition.createdBefore
params.description: This condition is satisfied when an object is created before midnight of the specified date in UTC. If a string is given, it must be a date in RFC 3339 format with only the date part (for instance, "2013-01-15").

params.name: condition.customTimeBefore
params.description: This condition is satisfied when the custom time on an object is before this date in UTC. If a string is given, it must be a date in RFC 3339 format with only the date part (for instance, "2013-01-15").

params.name: condition.daysSinceCustomTime

params.name: condition.daysSinceNoncurrentTime
params.description: Number of days elapsed since the noncurrent timestamp of an object. The condition is satisfied if the days elapsed is at least this number. This condition is relevant only for versioned objects. The value of the field must be a nonnegative integer. If it's zero, the object version will become eligible for Lifecycle action as soon as it becomes noncurrent.

params.name: condition.isLive
params.description: Relevant only for versioned objects. If the value is true, this condition matches live objects; if the value is false, it matches archived objects.

params.name: condition.matchesStorageClass
params.description: Objects having any of the storage classes specified by this condition will be matched. Values include "MULTI_REGIONAL", "REGIONAL", "NEARLINE", "ARCHIVE", "COLDLINE", "STANDARD", and "DURABLE_REDUCED_AVAILABILITY".

methods.name: clearRules
methods.description: Clear all Object Lifecycle rules or rules of a certain action type.

examples.caption: Clear any rules which have an age equal to 50.

params.name: action
params.description: If a string is provided, it must be the name of the type of rule to remove (SetStorageClass or Delete). All rules of this type will then be cleared. When providing a callable you may define a custom route for how you would like to remove rules. The provided callable will be run through array_filter. The callable's argument will be a single lifecycle rule as an associative array. When returning true from the callable the rule will be preserved, and if false it will be removed. Defaults to null, clearing all assigned rules.

exceptions.description:
If a type other than a string or
callabe is provided.
